articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Swiss President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Swiss President
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Johann Schneider-Ammann, president of the Swiss Confederation, on its national day.
					 Expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the Swiss president success in his work for the development of the country and well-being of the people.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A Japan-DPRK friendship educational interchange delegation led by Mamoru Sonobe, vice-chairman of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Sunday.
					 The members of the delegation laid a bouquet before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan-Korea Friendship Linking with Juche headed by Takashi Koiwai, vice-chairman of the Japan Matsumoto Citizens Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They made bows to the great leaders who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter Kang Pan Sok
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 84th anniversary of the demise of indomitable revolutionary fighter Kang Pan Sok, mother of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On this occasion, the DPRK people recollect with deep emotion the immortal feats she performed in pioneering a new era of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 She devoted her all to bringing up Kim Il Sung as the hero of the nation and the leader of the revolution who would accomplish the cause of national liberation and build a new society for people in Korea.
					
					 She often climbed Mangyong Hill with her son and implanted patriotism in his mind. When his son wrote letters "Korea's Independence" with brush, she told him to achieve the independence of the country without fail.
					
					 True to the intention of her husband Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement of Korea, she let her teen-age son embark on the 250-mile journey to experience the miserable life of the Korean people under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 She gave every possible assistance to the work of the Saenal Children's Union and the Anti-imperialist Youth League organized by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 She handed over two pistols, legacy of Kim Hyong Jik representing his firm will to liberate the country by fighting through generations, to Kim Il Sung and devoted herself to founding the first revolutionary armed force.
					
					 Thanks to her loving care and devoted efforts, the Korean people could acclaim Kim Il Sung as the great leader for the first time in history spanning thousands of years and under his leadership they could achieve the cause of national liberation and greet the heyday of prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Senegalese President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Senegalese President
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Macky Sall, president of the Republic of Senegal, on July 28.
					 The president said he was pleased to hear the news that Kim Jong Un was elected chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 The president sent warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and sincerely wished him great success in his noble work.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Congolese President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Congolese President
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Denis Sassou Nguesso, president of the Republic of Congo, on July 28.
					 The president extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the State Affaires Commission of the DPRK on behalf of the people and government of Congo and on his own behalf.
					
					 The president expressed the will to make efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, wishing Kim Jong Un greater success in his work.

articles.title: National House of Class Education
articles.content:
National House of Class Education
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The National House of Class Education was newly built near the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 What catches one's eyes are letters "Blood for Blood" carved in relief on its front wall, which makes visitors nurse revenge on enemies.
					
					 On display in the house are over 1 670 photos, 100-odd art works, including semi-panoramic pictures, wax replicas and sculptures, and 3,000 pieces of remains and evidence, which show the aggressive nature and brutalities of the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and the anti-national, anti-reunification moves of the class enemies.
					
					 Looking round the exhibits showing the U.S. history of aggression upon Korea and their crimes against the Korean nation, visitors come to be keenly aware of the true colors of the U.S. imperialists as robbers.
					
					 Among exhibits are those witnessing crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists to obliterate the Korean nation during their colonial rule over Korea as well as their hostile moves towards the DPRK.
					
					 The exhibits also show the anti-national and anti-reunification moves of the south Korean group of traitors and crimes committed by the class enemies.
					
					 The visit to the house makes all the servicepersons, working people, students and youth harden their will to make revenge upon the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and the class enemies at any cost.

articles.title: Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School
articles.content:
Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School was recently completed as a model of secondary schools in the DPRK.
					 All classrooms are put on multi-functional and IT basis and a network is built up in the school. Laboratories and practice rooms provide schoolchildren with all conditions for their learning.
					
					 It has also halls for the edification of schoolchildren, a playground covered with synthetic grass and gymnasium.
					
					 Corridors in the school are decorated with visual aids carrying various knowledge and common sense.
					
					 When visiting the school some days ago, supreme leader Kim Jong Un said with great pleasure that the Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School is perfect in design and construction, adding the completion of another home for orphans would add luster to the advantages of the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of giving priority to education and the Korean-style socialist system .

articles.title: Nutritive Jam
articles.content:
Nutritive Jam
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Nutritive jam, one of health foodstuffs, is highly appreciated among citizens of the DPRK.
					 The nutritive jam and the method how to make it were patented.
					
					 The main components of the jam are high protein of Tenebrio molitor L., mineral elements and nutritive supplementary. 
					
					 Kim Kang Ho, its maker, told KCNA that the nutritive jam has a good effect on health promotion by changing active oxygen in human body into nano-ionic oxygen.
					
					 The nutritive jam and its varieties are efficacious for amblyopia, arteriosclerosis, tuberculosis, radiation damage, arthritis and neuralgia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Pro-U.S. Diplomacy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Pro-U.S. Diplomacy
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The recent ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum held in Laos was a reminder of the miserable position of the south Korean puppet group.
					 When the south Korean foreign minister imprudently tried to shake the hand of the Chinese minister of foreign affairs first, with smile on his face with an awkward gesture, the latter just exchanged a handshake with the former with an expressionless look. From the very beginning of talks, the Chinese foreign minister reportedly pressed his south Korean counterpart by saying China would like to hear about what kind of measure south Korea was intending to take as regards the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 The Chinese foreign minister openly disclosed discontent throughout the talks with a callous and stiff look, waving his hand and having his chin in his hand.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says: 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group impertinently behaved to show "close relations" with China even ahead of the ministerial meeting, but was cold-shouldered and was held in contempt by Beijing and compelled to fly back in a poor shape after having a hard time.
					
					 From the outset of their office the Park Geun Hye group of traitors touted "balanced diplomacy" which calls for coordinating the relations with the U.S. and China in a balanced manner and, at the same time, plugging China into the campaign for "pressurizing the north." This diplomacy, however, has gone bust.
					
					 Various media, observing China's attitude towards south Korea, commented that the bilateral relations have made a U-turn.
					
					 South Korea is hit hard for complying with the U.S. demand for the deployment of THAAD.
					
					 This is an inevitable result of the diplomacy servile to the U.S.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces deserve the above-said cold treatment as they are prolonging their remaining days without any independent stand, being sandwiched between big powers.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye Group for Begging for "Cooperation in Pressuring North"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye Group for Begging for "Cooperation in Pressuring North" 
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye group of south Korea is going beyond the tolerance limit in its persistent moves for soliciting "cooperation in pressuring the north", regarding it as the ultimate goal of diplomacy to stifle the compatriots.
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes this in a commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 At the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Region Forum held in Laos, Yun Pyong Se, puppet minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, begged whoever he met for cooperation so that the "international community might send a strong message to the DPRK".
					
					 In order to properly solve the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula directly linked with global peace and security as desired by the Koreans and other people, the U.S. is required to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, to begin with, as it has staged ceaseless madcap drills for a nuclear war against the latter every year.
					
					 This is a proper order in settling the nuclear issue of the peninsula.
					
					 That is why the international community is urging the U.S. to show its will to opt for realizing the denuclearization of the peninsula by taking a practical step to pull its war hardware and aggressor forces out of south Korea. 
					
					 This being a hard reality, Yun ran the whole gamut of invectives in a bid to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad. This is no more than a desperate scream made by the traitor more dead than alive, taken aback by the daily rising dignity and might of the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime's confrontation with the compatriots in the north would only precipitate its self-destruction.
					
					 History will show how the Park Geun Hye group will meet its doom, cursed and condemned by the people for having cried out for confrontation and war in defiance of the proposal made by the north out of its good will and magnanimity.

articles.title: Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- 69 civic and social organizations of south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on July 28 in demand of the release of prisoners of conscience, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News. They included the Measure Committee of Civic and Public Organizations against Suppression under the Pretext of Security and the People's Solidarity for the Abolition of the "Security Law."
					 The speakers referred to Park Geun Hye's clarification of her will to grant special amnesty.
					
					 The people felt frustration and hatred whenever plutocrats were set free though they were convicted of scandals, they deplored.
					
					 They demanded the release of all prisoners of conscience including those charged with the involvement in the plotted rebellion, former members of the Korea Solidarity and the chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions.
					
					 Noting that whether Park Geun Hye can tide over the present crisis or not depends on how she grants special amnesty this time, they demanded she set free all prisoners of conscience and immediately repeal all the laws against human rights including the "Security Law."

articles.title: Coercive Formation of "Foundation" Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Coercive Formation of "Foundation" Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The foundation for preserving justice for the settlement of the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army in south Korea in a statement on July 28 condemned the regime for setting up the "foundation" which is little short of insulting the victims of sexual slavery. It groups civic and social organizations including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps.
					 It accused the regime of establishing the "foundation for aiding comfort women" in the wake of the "agreement" with Japan over the sexual slavery issue in return for a billion yen provided by the Japanese government.
					
					 Justice, human rights and proper settlement of the past history can not be found due to the regime's humiliating behavior of coming out for implementing the "agreement" which is devoid of measures like clear and honest apology and reparation by the Japanese government, it said.
					
					 It strongly urged the regime to make efforts for the proper settlement of the sexual slavery issue.

articles.title: Establishment of "Foundation" Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Establishment of "Foundation" Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People in an editorial on July 29 denounced the puppet authorities for setting up the humiliating "foundation" over the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 The editorial said that the "government" finally inaugurated the "foundation" under the pretext of rendering aid to the victims pursuant to the "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army last year.
					
					 The "agreement" devoid of official apology of the Japanese government was another mockery of the victims, and the "foundation" is not aimed at Japanese government's reparation, it said, adding:
					
					 The humiliating diplomacy of the regime has gone beyond the tolerance limit as evidenced by offering the gift so-called "settlement" of the sexual slavery issue to Japan and exempting it from basic responsibilities such as official apology and reparation.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to mark the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 A seminar was held by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and reading sessions at a school of Mali and by companies of Niger and Guinea on July 23 and 25.
					
					 The chief of the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea explained the details of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Shatter Imperialist Moves towards Aggression and War and Safeguard Peace and Independence" and said:
					
					 The DPRK had access to powerful nuclear deterrence under the Songun leadership of the respected HE Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrence serves as an almighty treasured sword for reliably defending the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the region and the rest of the world from the U.S. ceaseless threat of a nuclear war.
					
					 The Korean people will always win a victory in the confrontation with the U.S. as they are led by the outstanding brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Ecuadorian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Ecuadorian Figures
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a film show took place in Guaranda City of Bolivar Province of Ecuador on July 22 on the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Daniel Alvarez Celi, chairman of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification, said in his speech:
					
					 July 27 is the day when the heroic Korean people and army achieved a great victory in the three-year long Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The shining victory of the Korean people in the war would be unthinkable without the outstanding leadership of President Kim Il Sung, a great statesman and legendary hero in the 20th century.
					
					 Thanks to his Juche-oriented military idea, war methods, extraordinary strategy and tactics and commanding art, the Korean people could show their dignity before the world as the heroic people who defeated the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Julio Ballesteros Espin, chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People, said that the Korean army and people could shatter to the smithereens the myth of the U.S. imperialism's "mightiness" in the Fatherland Liberation War under the leadership of the President, adding that they could frustrate the vicious moves of the U.S. imperialists and the international reactionaries to ignite a new war against the DPRK and socialism and reliably defend the sovereignty of the country and the gains of the revolution.
					
					 The participants watched Korean films.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Denounce U.S. Provocations against DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Denounce U.S. Provocations against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Swiss preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on July 25 in support of the statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry which declared its determination to counter the violation of sovereignty and provocation by the hostile forces with toughest counteraction.
					 A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry released a statement to denounce the U.S. imperialists' invariable ambition to provoke the second Korean war, the joint statement said, and continued:
					
					 The DPRK, which won the Fatherland Liberation War thanks to the Juche-oriented stratagem and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, has become a nuclear power and elite military power and emerged ever-victorious in the all-out confrontation with the U.S. under the Songun leadership of HE Kim Jong Il and HE Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists failed to draw a lesson from the defeat in the past Korean war but have persisted in their scenario to stifle socialist Korea.
					
					 The spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry said in the statement that the U.S. will never be able to escape its final doom and no one will be left to sign a surrender document if it opts for igniting the second Korean war in defiance of the strategic position of the DPRK and the trend of the times.
					
					 If a war breaks out, the U.S. can not go scot-free.
					
					 The second Korean war will bring doom to the U.S.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed by Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed by Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- An article titled "DPRK celebrates anniversary of war victory when it defeated U.S. imperialists" was posted by the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia on its website on July 27, the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The article said:
					
					 The U.S. ignited the Korean war on June 25, 1950 with the ambition for nipping the DPRK in the bud and expanding a bridgehead for dominating the world.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists turn the whole of Korea including Pyongyang into a barren land during the war.
					
					 But the U.S. has suffered big losses in the three-year long war.
					
					 The Korean people turned out in the do-or-die struggle for defending the country.
					
					 Comrade Kim Il Sung led the Korean people to the heroic struggle against the aggressors in the whole period of war.
					
					 The victory achieved by the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War was a great event as they inflicted big defeat on the U.S. imperialists for the first time in history.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are working hard to bring the Korean people to their knees.
					
					 We extend congratulations to the leadership and people of the DPRK on the anniversary of the great war victory and wish them greater success in building a powerful socialist country.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows took place in Nigeria, Thailand and Slovenia from July 25 to 27 on the 63rd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 "Who drew the 38th parallel?" and other Korean films were shown.
					
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand said:
					
					 It is because of outside forces that Korea was divided into two and forced to fight even a war.
					
					 Korea's reunification can never be achieved as long as GIs remain in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. should retract its policy hostile to the DPRK.
					
					 Not only the Korean nation but also other progressive people in the world do not want another war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The chairman of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association praised President Kim Il Sung for inflicting an ignominious defeat upon the U.S. imperialists-led aggressors and defending the sovereignty and independence of the country.
